content: I know some of you here are in the VA's Lipid's Group. I went a couple of years ago, and they got me squared away with some recommendations, some Simvastatin, and some fish oil pills. A couple of months ago, a developed body aches and discontinued my statin. I'm back in the group, trying Pravastatin this time. Anybody here have any experience with this drug? I'm particularly concerned because my family history is full of muscle-cramp problems. I have cramps at night, mostly, and wind up jumping from bed. ...It scares the dickens out of my wife.

content: Muscle cramps and spasms are a serious side effect of most statin drugs. Given what you say about your family history, you may be more prone to these side effects. Have you told this to your doctor(s)? If not, you definitely need to do so ASAP! Good luck!

content: What? You don't like going from nitey-nite to attention on deck in one heartbeat? Welcome to "middle age", billbright! Got upgraded to Rosuvastatin, even more fun. One trick I learned is to sleep with the leg which is more prone to cramping elevated which doesn't make sense from a circulatory standpoint but it works. Other trick is to not have anything that you can push against in your sleep to aggravate the cramps. Ask your Doc if you can take your meds in the morning or at noon. Good luck

content: I am on Zocor a simvanstatin. I also got leg cramps bad enough to make me get out of bed and walk around to ease the cramp. I saw something on the internet about leg cramps and what to do, so I tried it. Worked great. Sounds kind of dumb but it worked for me. Unwrap a bar of soap and put it under the covers down at the foot of the bed. There is something in the soap that eases the cramps. I have had a bar of soap in my bed for almost a year now and have had only one cramp. Give it a try.

content: I had cramping issues long before Zocor. And, I can't rightly say it's the statins that's increased the incidence of muscle aches and cramps. But with the statins, I seem to get cramping all over, not just my legs and feet. I had a cramp in the side of my face the other day, for crying out loud. Problem is... at sixty three, things are changing anyway. I exercise quite regularly, but the aches seem to come at me differently than they did ten years ago. They feel different. Muscle aches just aren't the same thing, anymore. Much cramping comes from compressed nerves and other back related stuff so it's hard to discern the cause, sometimes. I studied up on Co Q10 after someone suggested it, and from the studies it appears to be a wives tale. I don't like to take stuff unless it's been used by millions for a few years, just to see how many of them have adverse reactions. I used to be prescribed quinine for leg cramps, but they don't do that anymore; carcinogenic or something.
